text: Kate Milligan Evans Edger (January 6, 1857 to May 6, 1935) was the first woman in New Zealand to get a university degree and the first woman in the British Empire to get a Bachelor of Arts degree. Edger's family moved from England to New Zealand in 1862. On 11 July 1877, she graduated from the University of New Zealand. ==Legacy== The Kate Edger Educational Charitable Trust gives money to help women get degrees. In 2004 the Kate Edger Information Commons was formed at The University of Auckland. == References == Category:1857 births Category:1935 deaths Category:New Zealand people
title: Kate Edger
